title: GCF Board opens B.19 meeting, elects Lennart Båge and Paul Oquist as new Co-Chairs | Green Climate Fund

time_markers.text: from Monday 26 February until Thursday 1 March
quotes: The B.19 Board meeting will therefore take place from Monday 26 February until Thursday 1 March, and will be presided by the incoming Co-Chairs.
He has been Head of Delegation to the Climate Change Conference of Parties for Nicaragua since COP 15 in Copenhagen.
He has an MBA from the Stockholm School of Economics and joined the Swedish Ministry for Foreign Affairs in 1974.

organizations.name: B.19 Board
quotes: The B.19 Board meeting will therefore take place from Monday 26 February until Thursday 1 March, and will be presided by the incoming Co-Chairs.

organizations.name: Republic of Nicaragua
quotes: Dr. Paul Oquist has represented the Republic of Nicaragua in international climate negotiations for many years.

organizations.name: The Commission of the Nicaraguan Grand Interoceanic Canal
quotes: Dr. Oquist is currently Minister-Private Secretary for National Policies of President Daniel Ortega Saavedra, and is also Executive Secretary of The Commission of the Nicaraguan Grand Interoceanic Canal.

organizations.name: Latin American and Caribbean Group (GRULAC)
quotes: He is a Member by the Latin American and Caribbean Group (GRULAC) to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change Standing Committee on Finance,

organizations.name: UN Framework Convention on Climate Change Standing Committee on Finance
quotes: He is a Member by the Latin American and Caribbean Group (GRULAC) to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change Standing Committee on Finance,

quotes: and represented developing countries on the Executive Committee of the UNFCCC Warsaw International Mechanism for Loss and Damage.

organizations.name: Committee of Experts on Public Administration (CEPA)
quotes: Dr. Oquist was also a two-term member of the Committee of Experts on Public Administration (CEPA) of the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC),

organizations.name: United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC)
quotes: Dr. Oquist was also a two-term member of the Committee of Experts on Public Administration (CEPA) of the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC),

quotes: Head of the Multilateral Development Department of the MFA,

quotes: Executive Board Member and Acting Director General of the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (Sida).

organizations.name: Global Environmental Facility (GEF)
quotes: Ambassador Båge represented Sweden i.a. in the negotiations on the establishment and first replenishment of the Global Environmental Facility (GEF),

quotes: served as Sweden's IDA Deputy for the IDA 10, 11 and 12 Replenishments

organizations.name: Green Climate Fund
quotes: facilitated and chaired the Initial Resource Mobilization (IRM) for the Green Climate Fund.

Dr. Paul Oquist has represented the Republic of Nicaragua in international climate negotiations for many years.
He has a Ph.D. in Political Science from the University of California in Berkeley, California.
He has an MBA from the Stockholm School of Economics and joined the Swedish Ministry for Foreign Affairs in 1974.
He has been Head of Delegation to the Climate Change Conference of Parties for Nicaragua since COP 15 in Copenhagen.
